transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm putting you idiots on notice. I want tonight's show to go off like clockwork, or else.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Or else what?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll heave you into the moat.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We have a moat?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Is it one of those above-ground redwood jobs?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nope, it's eight foot deep, steel reinforced concrete, with a smooth gunnite surface.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: D'ya have that installed with a permaflex?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You got the polyurethane coat?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: If you didn't, you got robbed.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Listen, we have two of TV's movers and shakers on the show tonight. If we play our cards right, we'll all be frolicking on the dock as we drink from the sweet gravy boat of success.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Mmmm, gravy! I can almost taste it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, why don't you go on up and order a big bowl of it?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, uh, get me one too.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes! Get us all one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in, with gravy mustache) Greetings, I'm Space Ghost. We've all been drinking gravy, and preparing to suck up mightily to tonight's guests, (reads with great difficulty) Talk show Soup person John host Henson, and Goen Bob Entertainment person Tonight.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (off stage) I heard Hanson was here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not Hanson, Henson. John Henson

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Ohhh. Oh. Hey, Space Ghost, you got somethin' on your face.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's gravy.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Where'd ya get gravy?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: In the commissary.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: What is it, giblet?!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, it's brown.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Brown?! I'm goin' down there now! (scats to himself)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, play something funky, I need to go get a Wet Wipe.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk, with a clean lip) Alrighty then! Please say hello to our first guest, Mr. John Henson.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: (lowers from ceiling on monitor) Hey, how are ya?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, Mr. Henson, the question is, how are you? You comfy? You know, you look quite beautiful tonight.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Hm? Sorry?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I said, you look very handsome tonight. You know, I know this girl, she'd be perfect for you.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Do ya.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: She's really nice. Actually, she's my sister Judy. You'd like her a lot.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (whispering) Hey!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (whispering) Hey! Hey, Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: She's so nice.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Right!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (whispering) Hey, Space Ghost, not Judy. No, no no, pass.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (whispering) Ya tryin' to scare him away?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (low voice) Sssh, we'll find somebody else to play my sister.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (whispering) You're gonna screw up this whole deal!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (low voice) Don't worry, I know what I'm doing. (normal voice) Because we want you to have a pleasant time on the show.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And after the show.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: (long pause) Oh.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty then. It's a date! Now, back to your stunning good looks. Do you use a conditioner or a creme rinse for your defect? I mean hair, hair hair is what I said.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Uh, well, I have a skunk spot (points to side of his head)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gasps) You're kidding! We wouldn't have even noticed if you hadn't pointed it out.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Really? Uh, which si-, ooh, yeah, right there.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Looks like a third eye to me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (low voice) Shhhh! Hey, hey hey hey, ix-nay on the ot-spay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (low voice) You idiot!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I, I mean, I like it. I like the third eye. It's neat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's the nicest third eye I've ever seen.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: You like that, don't you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Love it.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Big with the chicks!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, your money, baby!

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Am I?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (sings) Let's hear it for the spo-o-o-ot!

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, please.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, Mr. Henson, around these parts, we often refer to your show as the greatest program ever in the history of television. You have any pet names for my show?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Uh, that freaky cartoon thing, and, um, sometimes we just call it, uh, The Zorak Hour.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And so I crushed it in my bare hands! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (laughter)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in the keyboard pod) (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, shut up, fat boy!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: As you wish, my green lord.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Now, play me some music, and it better be good!

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (laughter)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't hurt me, master.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm comin' to get you! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No! Put that down! Not that! No! No!!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The Zorak Hour?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: I shouldn't have said that. I...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aims power bands at John) How do you feel about The Zorak Hour now?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Oh, um... I'd, I'd feel fear.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (whispering) Space Ghost, don't do this.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (whispering) You're blowin' it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (I'm blowing it!) John! Buddy! (stops aiming) Hold on, I wasn't gonna shoot ya! Just kidding! We do that with everybody here. We're still friends, right?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I would consider you and I to be very good friends, very close friends, in fact, I, I don't know if I'm movin' too quickly for you, but I, I think you might be my best friend at this point.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really??

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, you'll let me host your show sometime.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Which will, of course, lead to a lucrative picture deal.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: (nods) Absolutely.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can we go to the fun place?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: The fun time place, sure, sure!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm gonna drop your name at parties!

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Drop it, man. (sound of glass breaking) Let it fall, drop that name and see where it gets ya.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We're a team now, Johnny. Let's go kick some butt.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Okay, deal.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (low voice) Starting with Oprah.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: I don't think anyone's beaten Oprah, man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait 'til she tastes my vanilla thunder!

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: I'd like to see you dunk over Oprah. You think you could post her up?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'd post her up all right. You don't have to worry about that, my man.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Take Oprah to the hole, I dare ya!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm off to take Oprah to the hole. (flies off) (floating in space) I'll never be able to take Oprah to the hole. I'll just fly around a while and lie about it later.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Um, I've often thought that deep inside me there's a big Slavic nurse, just waiting to get out.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Whoa! Where did that come from?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Is that true?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: No, I just made that up.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh. 'Cause, I was gonna ask you to release her, if you could.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Release her! Release the big Slavic nurse!

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I bet you'd like me to, wouldn't ya?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well... sure.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Of course.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: You and everybody else, pal. Sorry, you don't have the money.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to his desk) Oprah's outside game was a shambles. I exploited her weaknesses time and again.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You just flew around for a while, didn't you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, Oprah and I... dribbled the ball.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Didn't ya?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes. Mr. Henson, does your tongue ever get sore?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: From talkin'. 'Cause mine sure does. After fifteen minutes of this, man, the ol' lickin' strip swells up like a big meatball.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: My tongue ever get sore?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, you know, when you...

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: What kind of question is that? What kind of a person do you think I am? "Does my tongue get sore?"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, did I say something wrong?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Backpeddle, rephrase question.) Hey, John, wanna see my tongue?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Oh no, I've lost it.)

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: (to Zorak) Is it me?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's not you, John, you're great. It's him!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (hesitant) John, I thought we were friends.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: You know that I promote you, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, sir.

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Right, so careful. I made you, and I can break you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but I still get to host your show, right?

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: I don't know if you could carry one off.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, no fair, you said I could... (sound of bee buzzing) Aaah! A bee! A bee! There's a bee in the studio! Aaaah!

transcript.speaker: John Henson
transcript.dialogue: Oh no!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This is fun, are you ready for this? Mr. Henson and I were actually co-presenters at the Dallas Local Ace awards. Real good guy, yep, real good guy.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's, um...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (belches) Oh, thank heavens, I thought he'd never leave.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever) Uh, Bob, can you hear me? (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor) ... you either.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Bob!

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Hey, how you doin'? This David?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, Bob, it's Moltar. Are you...

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: How you doin', Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Eh, no no Bob, Moltar. I'm gonna patch you through to Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Okay, I'll refer to him as...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: 'Kay, great.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ten seconds, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Uh, you know, I enjoy the work you do, and...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Bob?

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: You know, interviewing celebrities is not...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Bob?

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: ... easy, and watching you do it...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Bob!

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Pardon?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I'm Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, host of Entertainment Tonight, Bob Goen!

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: (lowers from ceiling on monitor) Uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Bob, how's it Goen? (laughs) Get it?

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah, life's pretty cool.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Know what I think, Bob? I think you're pretty cool.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Wh-, why is that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you know. A lot of different reasons.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: (nods)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You are one pretty man.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. Aren't you envious?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs forcefully)

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Really? That's an interesting response.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Interesting is my middle name, Bob. That's why you should have me on your show as soon as possible.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: You know, see, you're thinkin', you, you have a big, uh, a grand career plan, don't you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm only thinking of you, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: You are?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) And me, being on Entertainment Tonight.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: You know, we get a lotta letters, asking about, uh, when we're gonna have a, a animated talk show from outer space on the show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And?

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: And, so now that you're here...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! What about us?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, you guys too.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You were gonna leave us out, weren't ya?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, and take all the glory for yourself!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no, we're a team! (to Bob, quietly) They mean nothing to me, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I can understand.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dead.. weight.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Is your, your, uh, schedule is pretty open?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, let me tell ya, Bob. I'm busy for about fifteen minutes a week, but outside of that, I'm all yours.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Oh. Wow. Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All I ask in return is a couple of tickets to see your predecessor, my man Tesh.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: I can get you there. I can get you in the door.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob, you're the best. I'll have my people call your people.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Really?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Actually, I'll probably just call you myself from a payphone.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: I see.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I have an idea! Why don't you practice interviewing me now, then it will be more spontaneous when we do it for real later.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: That's right, yeah. Uh, so, uh, Space Ghost, if you could be any animal in the world, what would it be, and why?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um... I would think... an eel.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Why would you say an eel?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just because they're so neat.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: (nods) 'Kay, great. Uh...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost! (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What is it, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: There's a flood in the commissary!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What!?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Brak left the gravy faucet on!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gasps) The gravy!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's a brown onion-flavored nightmare down there!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Give me some biscuits, quick! (keeps jabbering)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, seal the bulkhead!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever) It's too late for that!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bilge out the bow and port thrusters! (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever) It's just too much gravy! The pumps can't take it!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: It's flooding like you wouldn't blblblblbl....

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob, I need to get down there before Brak drowns in rich creamy coagulated meat juices! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Oh. (back to control room monitor) Thanks, Space Ghost, I've really enjoyed myself.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) No, Bob, it's Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Exactly, yeah. Um...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Save your breath, chief.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost is gone.

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: Oh, really?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He blew you off!

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: You know what?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh...

transcript.speaker: Bob Goen
transcript.dialogue: That Tesh concert, forget it. He's not goin'.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I need to sop up the juicy flavor of the blblblblblbl....
